sect1.title: System Requirements for Operating Linux
sect1.para: The &slsreg; operating system can be deployed on a wide range of hardware. It is impossible to list all the different combinations of hardware &sls; supports. However, to provide you with a guide to help you during the planning phase, the minimum requirements are presented here.
If you want to be sure that a given computer configuration will work, find out which platforms have been certified by &suse;. Find a list at .

sect2.title: Hardware for &intel64; and &amd64;
sect2.para: The &intel64; and &amd64; architectures support the simple migration of &x86; software to 64 bits. Like the &x86; architecture, they constitute a value-for-money alternative.

listitem.para: All CPUs available on the market to date are supported. This includes dual-core CPUs.

The maximum number of CPUs supported by software design is 8192 for &intel64; and &amd64;. If you plan to use such large system, verify with our hardware system certification web page for supported devices, see .
A minimum of 512 MB of memory is required. Requirements depend on the application. However, the minimum recommended is 1024 MB or 512 MB per CPU on multiprocessor computers.

The computer can be booted from a CD or a network. A special boot server is required to boot over the network. This can be set up with &sls;.
